metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3981 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw in grub2 was found where its configuration file, known as grub.cfg, is being created with the wrong permission set allowing non privileged users to read its content. This represents a low severity confidentiality issue, as those users can eventually read any encrypted passwords present in grub.cfg. This flaw affects grub2 2.06 and previous versions. This issue has been fixed in grub upstream but no version with the fix is currently released.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.192
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.192
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.06-2ubuntu16
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu16
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.06-2ubuntu16
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu16
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Introduced by: https://git.savannah.gnu.org/gitweb/?p=grub.git;a=commit;h=ab2e53c8a196a595e50f1c836bf756b9db1ae68d eslerm> patch applied in grub-2.12-rc1

criterions.comment: grub2 package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
grub2-signed package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.192').
grub2-unsigned package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.06-2ubuntu16').
